DataElement.preferredDefinition: Free text field related to information different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned for the surgical margin following resection.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the surgical margin following resection.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:The edge or border of the tissue removed in cancer surgery.  The margin is described as negative or clean when the pathologist finds no cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has been removed.  The margin is described as positive or involved when the pathologist finds cancer cells at the edge of the tissue, suggesting that all of the cancer has not been removed.

Concepts.definition: of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

One of the criteria for assessment of the effectiveness of given surgical procedure in achieving the local control of a neoplasm and the adequacy of tumor removal. It is defined by the tissue plane through which the dissection has been done and the actual or potential neoplastic tissue which has been left outside the boundary of a resected specimen within the patient. There are four types of surgical margins: intracapsular or intralesional, marginal, wide, and radical.

Property.preferredDefinition: (ree-SEK-shun) Removal of tissue or part or all of an organ by surgery.

Concepts.definition: The surgical removal of a lesion, often as part of a biopsy and with healthy margins.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Updated to associate with Surgical Margin OC instead of post-coordinated surgical + margin, surgical was retired EVS concept

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The free text field related therapies different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.
